history.text: What's a good movie to watch?
You should watch Maleficent. It's a superhero movie with a CinemaScore of A
Like the Maleficent from Sleeping Beauty?
It was loosely inspired by it, yes. Instead of Aurora, it's about the antagonist. It stars Angelina Jolie.
What's it about exactly?
It's about Maleficent's relationship with the princess and king of the kingdom, which is currupt and filled with unhappy people.
Who else stars in it?
Sharlto Copley, Elle Fanning, Sam Riley, Imelda Staunton, Juno Temple, and Lesley Manville.
So what does the review say is good about the movie?
It says it "demolishes stereotypes" that appeared in the movie Frozen. Its story has thematic richness, and the title character, played by Angelina Jolie, is incredibly entertaining to watch.
How long is it?
It doesn't say how long the film is.
Who directs it?
It was directed by Robert Stromberg.
I wonder what "stereotypes" they're talking about.
I believe it refers to having a strong female character who doesn't need a man to validate and empower her. She is strong on her own.
Oh I see.  I like Angelina Jolie.
What else can you tell me about the movie?

Maleficent is a powerful fairy who falls in love with a human peasant. They grow apart and he ends up betraying her terribly. Maleficent is devastated and turns the Moors, where she lives, into a dark kingdom.
So it gives a back story as to why she turns evil.
What's a good scene?

King Henry declares on his death bed that whoever kills Maleficent will become the king and marry his daughter. Stefan, the human Maleficent had fallen in love with, drugs Maleficent but can't bring himself to kill her. He cuts off her wings with iron and brings them to the king to make him think she was killed by Stefan.
What are the ratings from other sources?
Rotten Tomatoes gave it 51% and Metacritic gave it 56/100
That's not very high.
It seems to have had limitations, probably in the budget. The only negative reviews seem to be about the set and design. Everything about the story has positive reviews.
How are the special effects?
Reviews claim "baroque visions of a colourful woodland enlivened by joyous fairies" and "bleeding-edge digital design".
Oh, that sounds interesting.
It seems very dark and fantastical,with a lot of livliness.

uid1response.feedback: It sounded like something I would like, especially with the special effects and actors.

uid2response.feedback: The document did not include the length of the film, which is a question I was asked.
